com.google.providerhelper
Class Wrapper

java.lang.Object
  com.google.providerhelper.Wrapper

public abstract class Wrapper
extends java.lang.Object

This provides a wrapper for an object which automates constructing it based on records retrieved from an Android ContentProvider.

To use this wrapper, extend this class, and for each ContentProvider column name (e.g. "foo") which you wish to process, provide a setFoo() method, where the name is capitalized and prefixed by "set". The method must take one argument, which must be of type Integer, Long, String, Float, or Double (the boxed versions, not the primitives).

The wrapper provides a constructor of one argument which is an Android.database.Cursor. It extracts fields from the Cursor and for each, calls your setXxx method if provided, extracting the expected type of argument from the Cursor.

This class may be used standalone with Cursor objects obtained anyhow, and is also designed to work with the "read" method of the associated Reader class.

Here's an example of a small class which represents the phone number and time of a phone call, and can be initialized by a Cursor from the CallLog.Calls Content Provider, which contains "number" and "date" fields.

  class Call extends Wrapper {
    String number;
    String date;
    public void setNumber(String number) {
      this.number = number;
    }
    public void setDate(Long date) {
     this.date = 
       DateUtils.formatDateTime(this, date, DateUtils.FORMAT_SHOW_TIME|DateUtils.FORMAT_SHOW_DATE);
    }
    public String toString() {
     return "Called " + number + " at " + date;
    }
  }
  
  // elsewhere
  Cursor cursor = activity.managedQuery( ... );
  ...
  Call call = new Call(cursor); // call.number and call.date are now set
